description: The Chevrolet Silverado, and its mechanically identical cousin, the GMC Sierra, are a series of full-size and heavy-duty pickup trucks manufactured by General Motors and introduced in 1998 as the successor to the long-running Chevrolet C/K line. The Silverado name was taken from a trim level previously used on its predecessor, the Chevrolet C/K pickup truck from 1975 through 1998. General Motors continues to offer a GMC-badged variant of the Chevrolet full-size pickup under the GMC Sierra name, first used in 1987 for its variant of the GMT400 platform trucks.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 2004 Chevrolet Silverado for consideration. This vehicle is coming to you in a sharp White exterior that looks phenomenal after receiving a full professional detail. This white exterior is paired with a gray leather interior that has held up nice and looks great. This Silverado features aftermarket HID headlights, Pace Edwards remote bed cover, AM/FM radio, air conditioning, heat, power driver seat, power passenger seat, power locks, power windows, power steering, power brakes, power mirrors, 20-inch wheels, SS badging and much more. The current owner of this truck has owned it for the last 3 years and is just selling because he has picked up something new. This truck is turn-key ready and a blast to drive, the vehicle comes with 2 sets of keys, the original owner's manual, a clean title and a clean CarFax.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

A numbers-matching 427 big block, four-speed manual, factory-correct Daytona Yellow, and a factory hard top – yes, this 1969 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray is everything you want in a fast and distinguished vintage 'Vette.  Also, this comes highly documented with it's original tank sticker, protect-o-plate, and more!

Daytona Yellow is a great color to have on a big block 'Vette.  It's a rare color offered for only a couple of years, and its name alone instantly reminds you of the Corvette's victories on the racetrack.  It brightly highlights the crisp lines of the big block hood and where the tall rear fender line meets the European styled Kamm tail.  And we know you'll love the way it also looks with the color-matching factory hardtop.  The early C3 cars are the ones to own because of all the great brightwork.  On a properly presented '69 that means nicely finished intricate chrome bumpers, bright rocker panels, and shining inserts so this Stingray's truly has gills.  Top it off with a correct rally wheel package on cool redline tires, and this is the kind of car that will grab attention in even the most finicky Corvette crowd.

Nothing matches up better on a yellow car than a dark black interior.  It's the kind of timeless color combination that looks both period-correct and will always have modern appeal.  The whole package is exceptionally tidy, which is a good thing because there will be plenty of people checking out the inside of this droptop as you go for a bit of wind-in-your-hair cruising. The C3 Corvette is a true driver's car with the three-spoke sports steering wheel, large dual gauges right in front of you, and a full set of auxiliary readouts to the side.  But we know what really grabbed all your attention... the bright chrome shifter seizes your focus like a beacon begging you to get in and start this one up.

When you twist the key, the symphony begins.  There's just no mistaking the big power and big rumble from a big block that's serenading through a dual exhaust.  With 390 advertised horsepower, this numbers-matching L36 427 cubic-inch V8 is a true legend forged in steel.  And lovers of originality will not only covet the motor, but the level of detail, too.   This one has everything you want from the shiny valve covers with correct Tonawanda decal, to the Rochester four-barrel carburetor still feeding the monster motor.  Out on the road, having the original Muncie M21 close-ratio four-speed means you get full control as you attack the backroads.  And the fully independent suspension, limited slip rear end, and four-wheels disc brakes means this classic has great modern moves, too.

The sale comes complete with a huge documentation packet, including warranty card, owner's manual, maintenance records, and it's original tank sticker.  So you have a beautifully presented convertible with all the right documentation for a true classic.  And also it's a huge power machine you'll love driving.  That level of appeal never stays around long, so don't miss out.  Call today!!!

title: 2005 Chevrolet Corvette Coupe

description: 2005 Chevrolet Corvette Z-51 LS2 Coupe For Sale in Cody, Wyoming  82414

If you are searching for something that is fast, fun, and fierce than look no further because this 2005 Chevy Corvette Z-51 Coupe is ready to inspire the adrenaline rush that you seek.  This handsome devil features a sleek, athletic styling that has become an icon of American made sports cars.  With LeMans Blue Metallic paint that is complimented by an exceptionally clean black leather interior this Vette is dressed to impress.  Powered by a 6 liter V-8 LS2 engine that is mated with automatic transmission, this vehicle offers 420 horsepower.  Its mechanical prowess is maximized by a performance package complete with Hot-or-Not remote that opens the baffles in the exhaust, creating approximately 30 more horsepower and a deep, throaty rumble all at the touch of a button.  With 75,0000 carefully driven miles you can rest assured that this stunning Corvette will be turning heads for many years to come.

The Chevrolet Corvette is a household name that carries a rich heritage laced with power and performance.  It has been produced over seven generations with each model year offering its own unique distinction.  This 2005 Corvette Z-51 is a C6 model that retained the front engine and rear transmission design of the C5, but was otherwise all new, including bodywork with exposed headlamps (a feature not seen since 1962).  It also comes fully loaded with all the bells and whistles.  Some of its advantages include heated and cooled seats, heads up display, navigation, anti-theft alarm, keyless entry and start, as well as great power options such as windows, seats, locks, A/C climate control, and cruise control.  Additionally, it comes with two Targa tops; hard painted and smoked glass.  It also comes with almost new, Michelin Z-Speed Rated tires valued at $2,000.

This 2005 Chevy Corvette Z-51 Coupe has been meticulously maintained.  This is a second owner vehicle and comes complete with all maintenance records and the original window sticker.  It has never been smoked in and has always been kept in covered storage, which has enabled its fantastic condition.  Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to own the sports car of your dreams at a very competitive price.  Call today for more information on how you can get behind the wheel of this beautiful beast!!!

2005 Chevrolet Corvette Z-51 LS2 Coupe

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to offer this highly original, high quality, 1979 Ford F150 Lariat 4X4 pick up for consideration. This truck spend the majority of its life in Utah and with the exception of a repaint in its original colors 20 years ago remains original. The truck is powered by its 400 CID V8 engine, 4 speed transmission with low gear, and part time 4 wheel drive with locking front hubs. This truck is extremely clean in all areas and is an exceptional driver in all driving situations from the farm field to the highway. The original interior remains in great shape showing less wear than one would expect. The dash, seat, carpet and gauge cluster all show very nicely. The exterior paint is deep and glossy, the Lariat trim package is complete, glass is good, the original frame and underside is clean and dry, etc.  Features included: original 400 V8, manual transmission, power steering, power brakes, jack, chrome step rear bumper, chrome wheels, Sparkomatic after market stereo with cassette, trailer brake, Lariat trim, good tires, etc.

Mechanically, this truck is rock solid, turn key and is ready to take anywhere. Classic pickups have taken over some ground in the collectible and investment vehicle market and clean, highly original trucks as the one offered here offers much potential in use and investment and will not last on our floor long.

Big block power, A/C interior, and a lifted 4x4 suspension that can take you anywhere – this 1986 Chevrolet K5 Blazer has the style to make an impression wherever it arrives, no matter if it's the car show or the campsite.

The K5 Blazer just has a big and beefy presence, and that aggressive attitude is heightened even further with a modern shade of blue that makes you take notice.  But the real attention-grabbers are the details.  The full-length pinstripe highlights the straightness of the sheetmetal as it coordinates with the removable white hardtop.  And this one is surely for the lovers of chrome.  Upgraded factory items like the mirror-like bumpers and large trailer mirrors are joined by Bully steps, cool 90-degree dual exhaust tips, and large 20-inch Hostile off-road wheels to create a seriously bright presence.  But just because this one look like it belongs on Main Street doesn't mean it has lost its functionality.  The LED light bar on the front, tough 4x4 prowess, and full trailer hitch package means this custom Blazer is your first choice for everything from a country weekend to the boat ramp.

Inside are more custom features built for show and function.  It starts with the seat covers that have a great bold blue presentation, and they are there to soak up the water and dirt so there's no waiting to hop in after a day's activities.   You've got a great list of upgrades from the three-spoke sports steering wheel, to the cup holder center console that was painted to match the exterior, to the AM/FM/CD stereo with an aux input and a set of serious Kicker subwoofers.  But the best feature that keeps these K5's always in demand is the removable hardtop that gives you the full open-air pickup experience.  And since the air conditioning is blowing cold, you can do it all summer long!

When you lift the hood, you're going to love that this big engine bay is filled with big block power.  So while the bright intake, air topper, and valve covers are nice for show, the 454 cubic-inch V8's best quality is the places it can take you. Topped with a Holley four-barrel carburetor for even more power, this one can get you through the worst nature can bring.  Plus, with the Rough Country lifted suspension, two-speed transfer case, and the aggressive tread on the expensive Lionhart LionClaw M/T tires, you've got a true go-anywhere 4x4.  The again, with power steering, front disc brakes, and a four-speed automatic transmission w/highway-friendly overdrive, this Blazer is easy to live with in the urban jungle, too.

This is the toy with the power to tow the other toys.  That kind of appeal is always in demand.  So when you can get it on a standout K5 that's available right now for an affordable price, well then, you know you need to hurry to grab this deal.  Call today!!!
The paint, four-speed, rumbling exhaust, and performance-built 396 big block V8 – this is a fully-built custom 1968 Chevrolet Camaro that has all the right investments to be a mean midnight machine.

If cars were actors, there would be no doubt that this one could play a villain in every movie.  The shiny jet black paint has so much luster that it looks like it's out to consume all of the light around it.  In fact, you almost don't notice the dual blue stripes at first, if they were not highlighted by the cowl induction hood that's been supersized for added aggression.  It gets even better at night where the high discharge headlights with LED surrounds make this dark Camaro look fearsome.  But as intimidating as this one wants to be, it still can't help but shine with some great brightwork on the bumpers, around all the glass, and outlining the wheels & rockers panels.  And there's no missing those large 17-inch Billet Specialties alloys.

Step inside, and this Camaro is just as deep and dark as the exterior.  But a tough appearance doesn't mean it's uncomfortable.  Strato bucket seats and full-length door armrests are part of a premium package Camaro.  You get a newer three-spoke sports steering wheel and beyond that the ''Monster'' AutoMeter tach with shift light gives you the most important information of this performance machine.  And just in case you weren't already clued in on what muscle machine this Camaro is, the auxiliary gauges and Hurst shifter just below it really let you know there's something mean under the hood.

From the moment you see the engine bay and the big block inside, you instantly realize why this Camaro needs all that extra tall cowl.  The 396 cubic-inch V8 has been dressed to impress with polished components like the air grabber, pulleys, steel braded hoses, bracer bars, and Chevy performance valve covers.  But more than just shine, there was a solid investment in substance, too.  This big bock features a Holley four-barrel carburetor, Edelbrock air gap intake, MSD ignition, and a set of Hooker long tube headers that feed the thunderous dual exhaust.  And best part of all, the four-speed manual transmission means you dial in your level of performance with a quick downshift.  Backing up this big power package are all the right components.  Up front there are SSBC disc brakes, and in the rear, there are adjustable traction bars.  The details are even taken care of, like the battery relocated to the trunk for better traction, and a Be Cool aluminum radiator to keep everything cool even when running hard.

Complete with maintenance records, this Camaro makes no apologies for what it is.  It's the aggressive bad guy on the streets, and you'll feel sooooo good driving it. Don't miss out on some sinister-style excitement, call today!

We are really excited to offer this 1964 Buick Custom Special Wagon for consideration. The word ''rare'' gets thrown around a lot in the collectible automobile markets, but is never more appropriate than this first generation Custom Special Wagon. It is extremely rare to see one of these listed for sale, and even rarer to find one in such excellent condition.

This Special Wagon is in excellent condition.  It originally came from California and is a very solid example.  It is powered by a 5.7 L crate 350 v8 with ported aluminum heads and GM '' Hot Cam'', built by Jon Moss Chevy Raceshop installed by Wheel to Wheel in Detroit, MI.  The car was rewired by the same shop and was given a new wiring harness and fuse panel.  It features stainless a stainless steel intake and sodium filled exhaust valves, Polished intake/valve covers/alternator.  The Buick has a new power steering pump and alternator.  The car was placed on the DYNO and pulled an impressive 477 hp!  The Special wagon has factory cold A/C R134.  The exhaust system includes Hedman headers, Flowmaster Mufflers, 3 inch aluminized exhaust front to rear with 'X' crossover pipe.  The car has a new electric brake vacuum pump, drilled and slotted rear rotors, vacuum assist motor for brakes, 4-wheel disc brakes with new ceramic pads front and back.   The 200R4 automatic transmission with overdrive has been rebuilt and has a new TCL floor shifter with a stall converter.  The power is transferred to the rear wheels through a 10-bolt Auburn Posi 3:73 rear end.  The fuel is held in a Stainless Rick's tank and has an in-tank electric pump and external filter.  The car rides on Hotch Kiss A-Arms front and rear control arms and has new coil over shocks in front and rear and has sway bars also.

The car was painted in ''2008 Mini-Cooper Pepper White'' by Santini of ''Overhauling.''  The Buick was accented well with pinstripes done by Dennis Ricklefs of ''Overhauling'' as well.  The rear bumper was custom made by a clay mold and hand laid fiberglass.  The front bumper was smoothed and tucked.  In 2015 the interior was completely redone.
This car was tastefully done and shows well.  It comes with a stock hood, extra parts and stacks of receipts and another seat.  This car is priced to sell and is sure to leave a smile on your face.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

Year 1961, Plymouth introduced a dramatic re-design of its ostentatious Fury of the year prior. Most notably was the removal of the massive tail fins, ''stabilizers'' as they were called in the sales literature. The new Fury was lower, sleeker, and carried a more futuristic design. The rear deck lid now flush with the top of the rear fenders with more subtle rocket style tail lights fixed to each side, with full stainless steel belt trim surrounding the car still gave the 61 Fury a prominent look.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to offer this one owner, 1961 Plymouth Fury. This vehicle was purchased new from Highland Plymouth Company as a dealer demo on February 22, 1962 and has remained in the hands of that purchaser until his recent passing and title was assigned to his widow. The car have always been cared for, remains completely stock and with the exception of some targeted refurbishment, the car remains highly original. Highlights included: 318 V8 engine, push button automatic transmission, power windows, power brakes, power steering, power windows, power top, front bench seat, multi-tone interior, futuristic gauge cluster with linear speedometer, dual exhaust, fender skirts, jack, spare etc. This highly optioned car is an excellent driver and a great example of American Big Iron innovation.

When it comes to investing in classic cars; uniqueness owner history, originality and documentation matter. This 1961 Plymouth Fury Convertible checks all those boxes and is a worthy candidate for anyone in the market. Documentation includes: Original sales order, original finance contract, original owner manual, original title, original extended warranty certificate offered by the dealer at the time of sale, original title, service records etc.

We are pleased to offer this 1964 Chevrolet Chevelle Malibu SS for purchase. 1964 was the first year of production of the very popular Chevelle. The Chevelle Malibu SS was Chevy's entry in to the muscle car battle, and muscle enthusiasts then & now still hold high praise for the Chevelle. 1st generation Chevelles are always head turners.

This SS runs and drives great! The car had a frame off restoration in 2008.  The engine was resealed and updated in 2017.  It is powered by a period correct 283 v8.  Engine upgrades include: bored .60 over, Holley double pump 4 barrel carburetor, Edelbrock intake manifold, Isky cam, headers and a secondary cooling fan with temperature sensor.  The engine is highly detailed with the addition of a chrome air cleaner, chrome ''Chevrolet'' valve covers, and chrome alternator.  The car is guided through its gears by a Muncie M21 close ratio 4 speed manual transmission with a Hurst Floor shifter.  The Chevelle has a Auburn 3:73 Posi 12 bolt rear end that was rebuilt in 2017.  The car has Moser axles, ceramic dual exhaust, dual chamber mufflers and chrome tailpipes.  The Chevelle rides on 18'' Riddler rims that match the paint color and accent the car well.  The car also has an aftermarket oi pressure, voltage and water temp gauge cluster, new battery and JVC CD player.
This 1st generation Chevelle SS is a great muscle car, and really fun to drive. These cars will never go out of style! Please call or email for more details today.

Chevrolet put the auto industry on notice when they chose to skip a year in production and wait to perfect the C4 Vette as they rolled it out as a totally new vehicle in 1984 to introduce to their loyal fan base.  The refined drivetrain, better performance and stylish looks was what was demanded and they delivered nicely in this new setup.

This very clean and well cared for Vette shows well for its age and has the iconic Gold Metallic paint from the 80's.  Complimented nicely by the dark brown leather interior and digital display to complete the package.  You can't argue that about this setup for the man with the parachute pants and high tops.  This car was delivered new out of Florida and remained in the sunny state till 1999 to make its adventures up to the Midwest.  From there it was exchanged a few times before resting in the hands of the previous owner for the past 16yrs.  The car remains mostly stock with some tasteful upgrades that include; ported Edelbrock Aluminum heads, Comp Cams camshaft, 1.6 ratio rockers with lifters, Accel intake manifold, Hedamn headers, Magnaflow Hi-flow cats, under drive pulleys, 3.55 gears, upgraded cooling system and 150amp alternator.  Vehicle has been tested at Knoll Gas Motorsports Park to run a ¼ mile in 12.32 seconds at a speed of 111mph.

The car is quite nice in appearance with exterior and interior in very nice shape along with working gauges, cold A/C and properly working power locks, power windows, power antenna, power seats and radio.  Car comes with proving ground printout, some receipts, clean title and clean CarFax.  You can't bring the 80's back, but you sure can relive them in this Corvette.

The second-generation Chevrolet Camaro was produced by Chevrolet from 1970 through the 1981 model years. It was introduced in the spring of 1970 Build information for model 123-12487 was released to the assembly plants in February of that same year. It was longer, lower, and wider than the first generation Camaro. A convertible body-type was no longer available. GM engineers have said the second generation is much more of ''A Driver's Car'' than its predecessor. The 1973 model year incorporated standard impact-absorbing front bumper system to meet new no-damage standards in 5 miles per hour (8.0 km/h) NHTSA safety legislation. The Rally Sport option, with its chrome bumperettes on either side of an impact absorbing urethane grill surround, continued for one more year due to creative bracing behind the front sheet metal.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 1973 Chevrolet Camaro Z28 for your consideration.  The car comes equipped power brakes, power steering, headers, Autometer Autogage RPM gauge, Pioneer CD player, owner's manual, front bucket seats, custom center console, American Racing Wheels, cowl hood, new starter pump and new battery.  The car was repainted in 2000 and shows well.  The 383 v8 runs well and is paired to a rock crusher 4 speed manual transmission.  According to the owner the engine was rebuilt 1,100 miles ago.  The car has 308 gears.  The suspension has been upgraded and it has also been lowered and given sub frame connectors.
